alert.note: Alert for Chesapeake; Norfolk, Portsmouth; Suffolk; Virginia Beach (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 3:18PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of , the City of Norfolk, the northern City of Chesapeake, the City of Portsmouth, the northeastern City of Suffolk and the City of Virginia Beach through 400 PM EDT... At 317 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Churchland to near Norfolk International to 9 miles east of Virginia Beach. Movement was north at 35 mph. HAZARD...Rain 1 to 2 inches. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Possible flooding of low lying areas. Locations impacted include... Virginia Beach, Virginia Wesleyan University, Old Dominion University, Downtown Norfolk, Regent University, Ocean View, Great Bridge, Kempsville, Deep Creek, Downtown Portsmouth, Churchland, Norfolk State University, Norfolk, Chesapeake, Portsmouth, Suffolk, Fentress, Norfolk International, Ghent and Norfolk NAS. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Chesapeake; Norfolk, Portsmouth; Suffolk; Virginia Beach
